intro: Dicliptera imbricata, commonly known as the African buttonweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered in fine hairs. Dicliptera imbricata is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain environments.
